text: The old interests of aristocracy - the romance of action, the exalted passions of chivalry and war - faded into the background, and their place was taken by the refined and intimate pursuits of peace and civilization.
author: Lytton Strachey

text: Americans will listen, but they do not care to read. War and Peace must wait for the leisure of retirement, which never really comes: meanwhile it helps to furnish the living room.
author: Anthony Burgess

text: In time of peace prepare for war.
author: Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus

text: Peace is that state in which fear of any kind is unknown.
author: John Buchan

text: When I leave here, when my final day on this earth is up, I want to leave in peace. I want to have peace in my heart.
author: Rodney King
